meanings.definition: The condition in which the male and female reproductive organs of a plant mature at different times.
meanings.sent1: In dichogamy, the plant's male and female parts don't grow together.
meanings.sent2: Dichogamy is important for plant reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The plant seemed to have a case of dichogamy, making it hard for the bees to pollinate!
meanings.sent4: The dichogamy of the flower was like a dance, with the male and female parts taking turns to shine.
meanings.sent5: Dichogamy ensures that the plant can reproduce successfully by avoiding self-pollination.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of temporal separation of male and female reproductive functions in animals.
meanings.sent1: Animals exhibit dichogamy when their reproductive functions are not in sync.
meanings.sent2: Dichogamy in animals helps in maintaining a balanced ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The dichogamy in the animal kingdom sometimes leads to funny mating rituals!
meanings.sent4: The dichogamy of the birds was like a symphony, each gender playing its part at the right time.
meanings.sent5: The dichogamy of the frogs was a natural marvel, ensuring successful reproduction in the wetlands.

meanings.definition: The state of having separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
meanings.sent1: The plant's dichogamy was evident with distinct male and female flowers blooming.
meanings.sent2: Dichogamy in plants allows for cross-pollination to occur.
meanings.sent3: The dichogamy of the plant made it look like it was wearing different colored flowers for a party!
meanings.sent4: The dichogamy of the plant was like a symbol of unity, showcasing diversity within itself.
meanings.sent5: The dichogamy of the plant was a beautiful sight, with male and female flowers harmoniously coexisting.
